newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's 8-month insurance premiums up slightly.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's 8-month insurance premiums up slightly.

text.p: Brazilian insurance premiums in the first eight months of the year rose a slight 0.2 percent to 10 billion reais ($9.73 billion) over the same period in 1995, the National Federation of Insurance Firms (Fenaseg) said.
Fenaseg said in a statement that car insurance accounted for 30.6 percent of all premiums and health and life insurance accounted for 19.4 and 18.5 percent, respectively.
Fenaseg said insurance claims as a proportion of premiums rose to 62.7 percent between January and August from 57.6 percent in the same period a year ago.
It noted insurance claims increased for general risk and car insurance.
